result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason D Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $100 plus costs.  Pay within 60 days or get an extension from the Clerk of Courts office.

Huber granted. 
May be transferred to Waupaca County.
Report no later than August 16th. 
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days. 
8/5/15 Amended per stipulation and order /s/TTF 7/22/15: The defendant will serve one-half of his sentence in the Portage County Jail with Huber privileges and one-half on Electronic Monitor.  All other terms and conditions of his sentence shall remain in full force and effect.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason D Peterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason D Peterson in court with attorney Chris M. Lummis. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:30 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea hearing at this time.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant is pleading to Count 2. Count 1 will be dismissed and read in.
Sentence will be argued. State offered withheld sentence with probation but Defendant refuses probation.

Atty Lummis concurs.

State has complied with victim notification statutes. Victim is not present.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Lummis for Defendant.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

Court has reviewed the facts in the criminal complaint.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Criminal Damage to Property 943.01(1)

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, not recommending restitution because victim did not make a request.
Atty Lummis makes sentencing arguments to the Court, shows photographs of Defendant and Defendant's girlfriend to the Court.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties, has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for a period of 90 Days
Huber granted 
May be transferred to Waupaca County
Report no later than August 16th
Report to jail today, sentence to comence within 60 days
Pay a fine of $100 plus costs
Pay $200 DNA Surcharge 
60 days to pay the fine/costs or get an extension from the Clerk of Courts office
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

9:02 a.m. Defendant Jason D Peterson in court with attorney Chris M. Lummis. David R. Knaapen (for ADA Cousins) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason D Peterson not in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:23 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins notes there is a written preliminary hearing waiver in the file. 
State files Information. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason D Peterson in court with attorney Chris M. Lummis. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered to Count 2 only. 

Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT: Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
(code only - see Adjourned initial appearance for minutes)
Adjourned initial appearance on January 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with Paul Kell or Tina Peterson.
Child placement must be conducted thru a 3rd party.

Defendant Jason D Peterson in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
 Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant would like an attorney but will not qualify for public defender.  He is employed by the Waupaca Foundry.
Court enters NOT GUILTY plea. 
Atty Constable indicates this is a felony case. 
Court cannot enter the NOT GUILTY plea. 
Court will continue this matter for 4 weeks to allow for the defendant to obtain counsel. 

Court questions the defendant re: bond. 
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
